Papp correlation

Source: R/Papp.R
Papp.Rd

Calculate the Z factor with the Papp correlation

z.Papp(pres.pr, temp.pr, tolerance = 1e-13, verbose = FALSE)

Arguments

pres.pr

pseudo-reduced pressure
temp.pr

pseudo-reduced temperature
tolerance

rounding tolerance to avoid rounding readings that are in the middle of the grid. "tolerance" adds flexibility in deciding point closeness.
verbose

print internal

Examples

# Example 1
## one single z calculation
z.Papp(pres.pr = 1.5, temp.pr = 2.0)
#> [1] 0.962332
# Example 2
## calculate z for multiple values of Tpr and Ppr
ppr <- c(0.5, 1.5, 2.5, 3.5, 4.5, 5.5, 6.5)
tpr <- c(1.3, 1.5, 1.7, 2)
z.Papp(pres.pr = ppr, temp.pr = tpr)
#>           0.5       1.5       2.5       3.5       4.5       5.5       6.5
#> 1.3 0.9208943 0.7357072 0.6290383 0.6271826 0.6858996 0.7656800 0.8501931
#> 1.5 0.9552137 0.8499334 0.7728520 0.7501411 0.7749505 0.8279008 0.8930795
#> 1.7 0.9736623 0.9138939 0.8665932 0.8471834 0.8578133 0.8919610 0.9406180
#> 2   0.9877275 0.9623320 0.9432543 0.9366532 0.9450048 0.9675653 1.0015334
